snippet: Henry M. Greenberg, the state-appointed monitor, stopped short of calling for a state takeover of the Rockland County district, but he did recommend appointing a fiscal overseer who could overrule the school board’s decisions.
abstract: Hank Greenberg, monitor appointed by New York State to investigate East Ramapo School District in Rockland County, delivers report sharply critical of school's board, but stops short of calling for state takeover of district; finds board has shown favoritism to Orthodox Jewish students who attend private schools in district, and recommends Legislature appoint fiscal monitor who could overrule decisions made by board and superintendent.
lead_paragraph: Henry M. Greenberg, the state-appointed monitor, stopped short of calling for a state takeover of the Rockland County district, but he did recommend appointing a fiscal overseer who could overrule the school board’s decisions.

headline.main: East Ramapo School Board Is Criticized by New York State Monitor
headline.print_headline: State Monitor Criticizes a School Board in Rockland
